meanings.definition: Administer the sacrament of the Eucharist to (someone).
meanings.sent1: The priest houseled the parishioners during the Sunday service.
meanings.sent2: I houseled the bread and wine to the congregation.
meanings.sent3: The cat houseled the mice with a feast of cheese.
meanings.sent4: The teacher houseled knowledge to the eager students.
meanings.sent5: The gardener houseled water to the thirsty plants.

meanings.sent1: The church members houseled the Eucharist with reverence.
meanings.sent2: She houseled the sacrament with a grateful heart.
meanings.sent3: The dog houseled the treat with delight.
meanings.sent4: The earth houseled the rain with open arms.
meanings.sent5: The child houseled the candy with joy.
